title: Oil Sector
text:
For technical traders, XLE, IYE and OILU share a common problem; they all track very closely and are high in short-term volatility from day-to-day and week-to-week. This makes them more or less inappropriate to common technical signals. If you wish to apply technical signals to your trading you might better apply them to SZC, which covers the entire spectrum of the energy patch. As it is "usually" not quite so short-term volatile, you might then better apply MACD historigram, Parabolic SAR, 10-day/30-day moving avg crossovers, etc, as your buy/sell trigger signals. This way you attempt to minimize emotion, opinions and hunches.

If there is a lo-vol broad-spectrum energy ETF, that also might be a good vehicle. I just don't know of one

My two cents.
